abstract.para: The Users Administration Tool allows you add, delete and modify the existing users and groups in your system.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The Users Administration Tool allows you add, delete and modify the existing users and groups in your system.

sect1.title: Getting started
sect1.para: You can start Users Administration Tool in the following ways:
When you start Users Administration Tool, you will be prompted for the administrator password. This is necessary because the changes done with this tool will affect the whole system.
After entering the administrator password, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows Users Administration Tool main window.

sect1.para: The Users Administration Tool main window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: Shows the available users. Depending on the GConf key /apps/gnome-system-tools/users/showall it will show the system users too.
Allows to add or delete users or modify user settings.
Shows a similar dialogue to modify group settings.

sect2.title: To add a new user
sect2.para: Press the Add button in the main dialogue; a new window will appear asking for the new user data. For adding a new user, you must provide at least the username and password (automatically generated, or by hand). Optionally you can specify or modify real name, office location, work phone, home phone, main group, shell used, home directory, user ID and a list of the secondary groups for the user.
Main group, shell used, home directory and user ID are automatically guessed depending on the selected profile.

sect2.title: To modify an existing user
sect2.para: Select the user you want to modify and press the Properties button; a window similar to the one used for adding new users will appear with all the user data, allowing you to modify them.

sect2.title: To delete an existing user
sect2.para: Select the user or users that you want to delete and press the Delete button in the Users tab. Due to the importance of this data, you will be asked for confirmation for every user you want to delete.
For security reasons, the home directory of the deleted users will not be deleted.

sect2.title: To add a new group
sect2.para: Press the Add button in the groups dialogue. A new window will appear asking for the new group data. For adding a new group, you must provide at least the group name and the group ID. Optionally you can specify the users that will belong to this group.

sect2.title: To modify an existing group
sect2.para: Select the group you want to modify in the groups dialogue and press the Properties button, A window will appear with the group's data allowing you to modify it.

sect2.title: To delete an existing group
sect2.para: Select the group or groups that you want to delete in the groups dialogue and press the Delete button in the Groups tab. Due to the importance of this data, you will be asked for confirmation for every group you want to delete.
